did.abstract: The University Publications and Design Department is responsible for the production of academic publications and promotional materials for the university. The bulk of this collection consists of the working files for Diane Golden, Director of UP&D, from 1988 to 2000.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:

Identification of item, date (if known); Western Connecticut State University Office of University Publications & Design Records; RG 7.3.2; box number; folder number; Western Connecticut State University Archives

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 2004, the University Publications & Design Department and the Office of Public Relations were brought together to become the Office of University Relations, which is now largely responsible for overall production of marketing materials for WCSU.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The University Publications and Design Department is responsible for the production of academic publications and promotional materials for the university. Their services include design, copywriting, editing and photography for newsletters, billboards, advertisements, reports, magazines, viewbooks, postcards, posters, brochures and more. They also produce printed material for annual events such as Honors Convocations, Commencements and the University Ball.

The bulk of this collection consists of the working files for Diane Golden, Director of UP&D, from 1988 to 2000. They consist mainly of original art and mechanicals for publications that are generated from the department. View books, course catalogs, registration booklets, Annual Reports, The Western Way, Faculty Guidelines, and Commencement and Honors Convocation invitations and programs have been removed from this collection and filed within the existing University Archives collections.

Of special interest are the files for Opening, an independent magazine which was affiliated with WCSU. The monthly magazine previewed professional level arts in the Greater Fairfield County area. Among the founders were WCSU faculty members Lionel C. Bascom, John P. Briggs, Edward Hagan, Albert C. Stewart, Diane Golden, Abe Echevarria, Howard Tuvelle, and Hugh McCarney. The files contain correspondence, history of the tabloid, the premier issue of Opening (spring 1990), information on printing specs, stationery and photographs.
Series XIII contains photographs from the late 1980s up to the 2000s.

Series XIV is the the University Photographer's (Peggy Stewart) archive which spans the years 1997-2014. There is overlap with materials in Series XIII and with RG8 WCSU Photographs and Miscellanea. The materials in series XIV began being accessioned in the summer of 2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are grouped into 14 series.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Project Acorn was a greening of WestConn project conceived by the all-volunteer Center for Urban Studies and supported by the college administration, Alumni Association, and the midtown dorm council. The project called for planting shade trees, evergreens, flowering trees and flower, and installing brick patios, flagstone paths, outside seating arrangements, additional stairs, pathways and ramps around the Ruth A. Haas Library.
